Welcome to Contacts project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.ban_ips(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The ban_ips function is a middleware function that checks if the client’s IP address is in the banned_ips list. If it is, then we return a JSON response with status code 403 and an error message. Otherwise, we call the next middleware function and return its response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the client’s ip address

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the middleware chain to ban_ips

Returns:

A jsonresponse with a status code of 403 and a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by executing a SQL query to check if it can connect to the database and retrieve data. If it cannot, then an HTTPException is raised with status code 500 (Internal Server Error) and detail message &quot;Error connection to database&quot;. Otherwise, if everything works as expected, then we return {&quot;message&quot;: &quot;Welcome to FastAPI!&quot;}.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.index(request: Request)¶

The index function is executed when someone visits the root URL of our site: http://localhost:8000/ It returns a TemplateResponse, which contains both a template and data to be used by that template. The first argument to the TemplateResponse constructor is the name of the template file we want to use. In this case, it’s index.html in our templates directory.

Parameters:

request – Request: Pass the request object to the template

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A list of functions that are executed when the application starts

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository CONTACTS¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the data passed in by the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user from the database and use it to create a contact

Returns:

The contact object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is only deleting contacts they have created

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(days: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The get_birthday_contacts function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next ‘days’ days.
The function takes in three parameters:

  1. days - an integer representing the number of days to look ahead for birthdays. For example, if you want to find all contacts with birthdays in the next week, pass 7 as this parameter.

  2. db - an AsyncSession object from SQLAlchemy’s asyncio engine (see https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/dialects/asyncpg.html#asynchronous-execution). This is used by

Parameters:

  • days – int: Specify the number of days in which to search for birthdays

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next n days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to get their own contacts

Returns:

A single contact from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of rows to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_params(name: str | None, surname: str | None, email: str | None, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The get_contacts_by_params function is used to get contacts by name, surname or email.
Args:

name (str): The contact’s first name. surname (str): The contact’s last name. email (str): The contact’s e-mail address.

Parameters:

  • name – str | None: Filter the contacts by name

  • surname – str | None: Filter the contacts by surname

  • email – str | None: Filter the contacts by email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A list of dictionaries with the following structure:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactSchema): A ContactSchema object containing all fields for a new Contact object. db (AsyncSession): An async session with an open transaction to use for querying and updating data in the database. This is provided by FastAPI via Dependency Injection, so you don’t need to worry about it! Just make sure you include it as an argument in your function definition, and FastAPI will handle passing this parameter when calling your function!

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact with that id from the database

  • body – ContactSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user from the jwt token

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user that is being confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the data that is passed into the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The newly created user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to update

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database

  • token – str | None: Specify the type of the token parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contactschema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list containing the id, name and email of the deleted contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(birthday_days: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_birthday_contacts function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next

number of days specified by the birthday_days parameter. The user is authenticated using the auth_service, and then passed to repository_contacts.get_birthday_contacts along with db and birthday days.

Parameters:

  • birthday_days – int: Specify the number of days to look ahead for birthdays

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with a birthday in the next x days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. It requires an authorization token in order to access it.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id in the url path

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object, which is a pydantic model

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value for a parameter

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the query

  • ge – Specify that the value must be greater than or equal to 10

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_params(name: str | None = None, surname: str | None = None, email: str | None = None, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_by_params function is used to retrieve contacts from the database.

The function takes in a name, surname and email as parameters. If no parameters are provided, all contacts will be returned.

Parameters:

  • name – str | None: Filter the contacts by name

  • surname – str | None: Filter the contacts by surname

  • email – str | None: Search for a contact by email

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the parameters

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of the contact to be updated, and a body containing all fields that need to be updated. If no body is provided, then nothing will be changed in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body and convert it into a contact object

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file uploaded by the user, and uses it to update their avatar URL on Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

:param : Get the current user :return: The current user :doc-author: Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message if the email is already confirmed or a different one if it is not

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_reset_password(token: str, password1: str, password2: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password. It takes in the token, password 1 and 2 as parameters. It then checks if the passwords are equal, if not it raises an HTTPException with status code 400 and detail &quot;Your passwords are not the same&quot;. If they are equal it gets the email from token using auth_service.get_email_from_token(token). Then it gets user by email using repository users get user by email function (repository users get user by email returns a User object). Then we set that User objects password to be what was passed in

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • password1 – str: Get the new password from the user

  • password2 – str: Make sure that the user entered the same password twice

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A jwt, which is a json object with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes a refresh token as input and returns an access token. The function first decodes the refresh_token to get the user’s email address, then it gets that user from our database, and checks if their stored refresh_token matches what was sent in with this request. If not, we raise an error and return a 401 Unauthorized response code (the client will need to log in again). If everything checks out, we create new tokens for this user using our auth service module and update their record in our database with these new tokens.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the access token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

:param : Get the user from the database :return: A new access token and refresh token :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is called when the user clicks on the &quot;Verify Email&quot; button. It sends a verification email to the user’s email address, and returns an image that says &quot;Check your inbox for a verification link.&quot; The image is displayed in place of the &quot;Verify Email&quot; button.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username from the url

  • response – Response: Return the response to the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A fileresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(body: RequestEmail, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the user id from the token :return: A message :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository function

:param : Get the user’s email and username to send an email :return: A user object :doc-author: Trelent
